title: Warriors-Wolves ppd. after Minneapolis shooting
content: The NBA has postponed Saturday's game between the Timberwolves and Warriors in Minneapolis amid growing unrest after a Saturday morning confrontation with federal immigration officers ended in a man being shot and killed.

title: Steelers verbally agree with McCarthy as coach
content: The Steelers have a verbal agreement with former Cowboys and Packers coach Mike McCarthy to become their next head coach, the team announced Saturday.

title: Source: Ohio State to hire ex-Steelers OC Smith
content: Ohio State is finalizing a deal to make former Pittsburgh Steelers playcaller Arthur Smith its offensive coordinator, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Wagler wows 'em: Frosh has 46, Illini stun Purdue
content: Keaton Wagler, a freshman guard who finished the day with 13-of-17 shooting, scored a career-high 46 points, making nine 3-pointers, as No. 11 Illinois upended No. 4 Purdue 88-82 on Saturday, allowing the Illini to improve to 17-3 and 8-1 in the Big Ten.

title: Dybantsa's 1st 40-point effort lifts BYU over Utah
content: BYU forward AJ Dybantsa scored 43 points on 15-of-24 shooting from the floor, breaking his program's freshman scoring record, as the No. 13 Cougars cruised to a 91-78 victory over the rival Utah Utes on Saturday.

title: Rodman marks 'fresh start' in scoring U.S. return
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes heralded a "fresh start" for Trinity Rodman after the forward scored in just her second match since the 2024 Olympics in a 6-0 rout of Paraguay.

title: Sans ropes, Honnold climbs to top of Taipei 101
content: American Alex Honnold climbed to the top of the 1,667-foot Taipei 101 skyscraper on Saturday without the help of ropes or any protective equipment.

title: Nashville teen Brown keeps pace, 1 back in AmEx
content: Blades Brown, an 18-year-old from Nashville, Tennessee, finished with three straight birdies Saturday and sits one shot behind Si Woo Kim going into the final round of The American Express.

title: üèà Reid's NFL draft QB Hot Board: Mendoza top?
content: Who are the best quarterbacks in the 2026 class? We sized up the top 12, starting with Fernando Mendoza and Ty Simpson.

title: Follow live: Ukraine's Oliynykova targets Sabalenka again; Djokovic sorry for almost striking ball kid
content: World No. 1s Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka will return to Rod Laver Arena on Day 8, eyeing their places in the quarterfinals.Coco Gauff and top-ranked Australian Alex de Minaur will also be in action.

title: Steelers to hire Mike McCarthy: Six questions on the new coach, plus a grade
content: The Pittsburgh native and former Dallas Cowboys coach will take over a team with questions starting with QB.

title: Midseason lessons for all 30 NBA teams: Trade dramas, standings surprises dominate the first half
content: What have we learned about every team throughout the first half of 2025-26? Tim Bontemps canvasses the league.

title: Broncos' elite defense has a weakness the Patriots are set up to exploit
content: Denver's D has been vulnerable to big plays from running backs and tight ends in the middle of the field.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: Two NFL conference title games, two matchup previews: We have predictions, score picks and X factors
content: Drake Maye vs. Jarrett Stidham. Matthew Stafford vs. Sam Darnold. We have picks, stats to know and more for the AFC and NFC title games.

title: Breaking down Pats-Broncos, Rams-Seahawks via Next Gen Stats
content: Drake Maye vs. the blitz? Sam Darnold using play-action? Here are key metrics to help analyze Sunday's games.

title: Can Sam Darnold overcome his nemesis -- the L.A. Rams -- to get to Super Bowl?
content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold has struggled with turnovers against the Rams. Will Sunday be different?

title: How NFL players prepare for the coldest games of the year
content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

title: Liverpool's inconsistencies have never been made more apparent
content: Liverpool's last-minute loss to Bournemouth has further strengthened the faults that the team has encountered all season long.

title: Barcelona deny Real Madrid another trophy, but the gap is closing
content: Barcelona may have lifted their sixth Spanish Supercopa in a row, but it's clear that Real Madrid can now go toe-to-toe with their eternal rivals.

title: Leicester City? Texas Western? A search for Indiana football's best cross-sport comparison
content: Was Indiana's title the greatest story in sports history? There might never be an objective answer, but we polled our experts for comparable arguments in other sports.

title: Ranking the 100 best college football players from the 2025 season
content: Which players take the top spots? After an obvious choice at No. 1, the decisions weren't easy. Our experts tried to crack the code.

title: 8 things to know about the men's college hoops season
content: The good (Nebraska), not-so-good (Kentucky) and interesting (dominant freshmen) of the 2025-26 season so far.

title: Women's Bracketology: Chavez, OT win boost Sooners' hopes of hosting
content: Three straight losses sent the Sooners tumbling out of the top 16. They return after beating South Carolina.

title: Predictions for rest of MLB offseason: Where will the best ace available sign? Who will make a major trade?
content: How will the rest of free agency play out? Here's what our experts think could go down between now and spring training.

title: The new Mets are better than the old Mets -- and we can prove it
content: New York will have a new look for 2026. We break down what has changed and whether the team has improved.

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus each team's top celebrity fan
content: The Canes move into the top 3, while the Penguins and Mammoth rise too. Which team was the biggest faller?

title: Top 25 portal classes: Indiana, Texas Tech reload and the Portal King comes to LSU
content: These teams nailed their top targets or won a QB battle. Others had to reload at quite a few positions.

title: Keep, cut or add? What to do with George, Markkanen and six other trending players
content: Helping you decide whether to give up on a few struggling players or believe in those who are ascending.

title: Pak Human Rights Lawyers Jailed To 17 Years Over Social Media Posts
content: A Pakistani court on Saturday sentenced two human rights lawyers to 17 years in prison each over social media posts the authorities claimed were hostile to the state and its security institutions.

title: "What Did You Do?" Videos Show Chilling Moments During Minneapolis Shooting
content: Newly surfaced videos have revealed disturbing angles of the chaotic moments when the federal immigration officers shot dead 37-year-old Alex Jeffrey Pretti during an immigration operation in Minneapolis

title: 13,000 Flights Cancelled As Massive Winter Storm Hits US
content: About 13,000 flights were cancelled Saturday and Sunday across the US, according to the flight tracking website FlightAware.

title: Man Shot Dead By US Immigration Agents In Minneapolis, 2nd Killing This Month
content: Federal officers have shot another person in Minneapolis amid the Trump administration's immigration crackdown, Governor Tim Walz said Saturday.

title: 'SIR To Be Extended Nationwide Soon': Poll Body Chief Gyanesh Kumar
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar announced on January 23 that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls will soon be rolled out across all remaining states.

title: Snow, Ice Hit Western, Central US As Massive Storm Sweeps Nation
content: A massive winter storm dumped snow and freezing rain on New Mexico and Texas Saturday as it spread across the United States towards the northeast, threatening tens of millions of Americans with blackouts, transportation chaos and bone-chilling cold.

title: Maharashtra Man Kills Wife, Tries To Pass Off Murder As Cardiac Arrest
content: A 48-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife in Maharashtra's Beed district and attempting to pass it off as a natural death, police said on Saturday.

title: 'Doctor', 'Dr' Not Exclusive To Medical Professionals: Kerala High Court
content: Justice V G Arun said that the word 'doctor' was initially used for referring to someone who had achieved the highest level of learning and had received a licence to teach in fields like theology, law and philosophy.

title: Bank Unions Call For Strike On Tuesday Over 5-Day Work Week Demand
content: Major bank employee and officer unions in India have announced a nationwide strike on January 27 to press for the introduction of a five-day work week in the banking sector.

title: Ukraine, Russia, US Agree To Continue Talks In UAE On February 1
content: Ukraine and Russia ended two days of US-brokered direct talks on Saturday and agreed to hold more next week in Abu Dhabi, even as Kyiv accused Moscow of undermining the negotiations towards ending the war by launching fresh strikes.

title: CBI Court Reverses Discharge Of Bhupesh Baghel In 'Sex CD' Case
content: A special CBI court on Saturday reversed a magisterial court order that had discharged Bhupesh Baghel from a case regarding the alleged circulation of a sleaze video purportedly depicting former minister Rajesh Munat in 2017.

title: "No Internal Democracy, Rahul Gandhi's Decision Final": Ex-Congress Leader
content: Former Congress leader Shakeel Ahmad lashed out at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over the party's consistent electoral failures, claiming an unwillingness within the party to address the issues.

title: Manali Nightmare: 8-km Jam, Hotels 100% Occupied, Tourists Stranded On Road
content: The roads leading to Himachal's tourist hotspot of Manali in Kullu district are crammed with vehicles, stuck in massive traffic jams for hours. On one stretch, between Kothi and Manali, the jam stretched for 8 km.

title: 'Agent Feared For Life, Fired Defensive Shots': US On Minneapolis Shooting
content: A man shot and killed by federal agents in Minneapolis on Saturday was armed and "violently resisted" attempts by officers to disarm him, the US Department of Homeland Security said.

title: Missing Physiotherapy Student, 22, Found Hanging From Tree In UP
content: A 22-year-old physiotherapy student, who had been missing for two days, was found dead on Saturday with her body hanging from a tree here, police said.

title: O Panneerselvam Loyalist, Rajya Sabha MP R Dharmar Returns To AIADMK
content: R Dharmar, a Rajya Sabha MP and a loyalist of ousted AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam, on Saturday rejoined the AIADMK after calling on party general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami here.

title: Professor Stabbed To Death By Passenger In Mumbai Local Train, Cops Checking CCTVs
content: For Alok Singh, it would have been just another day of hectic urban commute in a local train in the entertainment and financial capital of the country. But he had an argument with another passenger over a petty matter.

title: 683 Roads Blocked, 5,700 Transformers Hit: Snow Disrupts Life In Himachal
content: Widespread rainfall and heavy snowfall across Himachal Pradesh over the past 24 hours have severely disrupted public utilities, blocking hundreds of roads and affecting electricity and water supply in several districts.

title: US Immigration Under Fire Again After Detaining 2-Year-Old In Minneapolis
content: A 2-year-old was taken into US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) custody on Thursday in Minneapolis. The child was with her father when they were detained, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said, according to a report by NBC News.

title: 16 IEDs, 100kg Explosives Seized As Security Forces Foil Maoist Plot
content: In a major success for security forces combating left-wing extremism in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, a joint operation on Saturday led to the recovery of a significant cache of improvised explosive devices (IEDs).

title: Who wins the 2026 national title? We predict the CFP bracket
content: a 12-team playoff has turned out to be a lot of fun, but we stick with 12 for a while longer . if we simply used Schlabach's rankings for this exercise, we'd be looking at a field resembling this . it's time for the next step in the predictions process: let's talk about who will make the college football playoff .

title: 'What did you just do!' Second killing in Minneapolis by US federal agents - video captures horror
content: A second US citizen, Alex Jeffrey Pretti, was killed by Border Patrol officers in Minneapolis, weeks after another fatal shooting by federal agents. Footage shows officers tackling Pretti, who was holding a phone, and firing multiple shots even after he collapsed. Officials claim Pretti violently resisted disarming, but his family describes him as a caring nurse.

title: UP woman, wanting divorce, plants beef to frame husband in cow slaughter case
content: A shocking plot unfolded when a routine cow slaughter seizure revealed a wife's elaborate scheme to frame her husband for a second time.  Driven by a desire for divorce, she allegedly conspired with her lover, using burner phones and fake identities to plant beef and ensure his arrest.  The investigation uncovered a chilling tale of betrayal and manipulation.

title: Heavy snowfall in Himachal: 685 roads closed, hundreds of tourists stranded
content: Himachal Pradesh grapples with severe disruption as heavy snowfall paralyzes transport, power, and water supply across multiple districts. Lahaul and Spiti remains cut off, with hundreds of tourists stranded in Manali. Authorities are working on a war footing to clear roads and restore essential services amidst freezing temperatures and significant snowfall in popular tourist spots.

title: Amid cheating claims, Palash Muchhal deletes all Smriti Mandhana photos
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal faces renewed cheating allegations from actor-producer Vidnyan Mane, a friend of Smriti Mandhana. Mane claims Muchhal was caught with another woman during pre-wedding festivities, leading to a physical confrontation with cricketers. Muchhal has denied these claims, initiating a Rs 10 crore defamation suit against Mane.  Several Instagram posts featuring Mandhana have also been removed.

title: Infosys asks employees to share home electricity bill data; here‚Äôs why
content: Infosys is now collecting household electricity data from employees working remotely to enhance its sustainability efforts. This initiative aims to accurately measure the environmental impact of hybrid work and refine clean energy strategies. The company, already a leader in renewable energy sourcing, seeks to further reduce its carbon footprint by understanding home energy consumption patterns.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: 70-year-old Odisha man cycles 600km to take ailing wife to hospital in rickshaw
content: A 70-year-old man in Odisha pedalled his rickshaw van 300 km to take his wife for medical treatment and is now returning home the same way, refusing help. His unwavering devotion highlights the struggles of the poor in accessing healthcare and transport, a story that has gained significant attention.

title: Ravindra Jadeja's 'attack kar' call sets up Shubman Gill's dismissal | Exclusive
content: Ravindra Jadeja's constant encouragement proved pivotal as Saurashtra's Parth Bhut dominated Shubman Gill, taking 10 wickets in their Ranji Trophy win over Punjab. Bhut, inspired by Jadeja, credited his hero's guidance for his match-winning performance and fulfilling a childhood dream of playing alongside him.

title: 'She stopped crying to survive': Father beats 4-year-old to death over maths homework
content: A four-year-old girl in Faridabad was allegedly beaten to death by her father for a math assignment error. Neighbors reported the father, a private firm employee, frequently abused the child when drunk. The girl, Vanshika Jaiswal, was reportedly conditioned to avoid crying in front of him due to his violent reactions.

title: Amazon layoffs 'announced'; company set to cut thousands of jobs
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: 'Border 2' box office collections day 2
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has made a strong debut, earning Rs 65 crore in its first two days. The war drama is projected to reach Rs 70 crore by its third day, solidifying its position as Sunny Deol's fourth highest-grossing film. The movie's success highlights Deol's continued box office appeal.

title: 2 die as bullet train bridge plate ‚Äòfalls‚Äô in Gujarat
content: A father and daughter tragically lost their lives when a heavy metal plate fell from an under-construction bullet train bridge onto their fishing boat on the Tapi River. The incident occurred near Kathore village, with the plate reportedly slipping from a crane. While the mother survived, the deceased were identified as Mohsin Shaikh and his nine-year-old daughter, Huma.

title: 'There's a coach at home': SKY reveals how his wife helped him rediscover form
content: Suryakumar Yadav revealed how patience, time in the middle, and a social media break helped him regain form after a challenging period. He credited his wife's advice and a focus on match performance over net sessions for his improved confidence.  He also emphasized the importance of team wins beyond individual performances.

title: Why Microsoft is asking engineers to test Claude Code alongside GitHub Copilot
content: Microsoft is now having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in AI coding tools, with even non-technical staff encouraged to experiment.  Nvidia's CEO also recently urged engineers to embrace AI coding assistants, highlighting a significant industry shift.

title: 80 rescuers, no saviour: Who let Noida techie Yuvraj Mehta drown?
content: A young software engineer drowned in a Noida trench despite a massive rescue operation involving multiple agencies. Officials and the victim's father decried the "institutional failure," citing a lack of training, equipment, and coordination among first responders and specialized units. The tragedy exposed critical gaps in India's emergency response mechanism.

title: Mumbai Police books Vikram Bhatt, daughter in Rs 13.5 crore cheating case
content: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his daughter Krishna Bhatt are facing a new fraud case in Mumbai, accused of cheating a Pune-based investor out of Rs 13.5 crore. The investor claims they were promised high returns on film projects but never received their principal or profits. The investigation has been transferred to the Economic Offences Wing.

title: Fans urge Travis Kelce to apologize to Justin Baldoni amid backlash
content: Travis Kelce's Instagram comments are buzzing with criticism, not football talk. A viral plea for him to apologize to 'Justin' on his podcast has ignited widespread demand for accountability. Notably, some Swifties are joining the chorus, questioning the situation's handling, a shift that amplifies the online discourse and Kelce's continued silence.

title: Buffalo Bills fans rally to bring back ex-coach Sean McDermott after firing
content: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott‚Äôs dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott‚Äôs firing.

title: NBA postpones Warriors-Timberwolves over Minneapolis shooting
content: A fatal shooting involving federal agents in Minneapolis has led to the postponement of the Golden State Warriors vs. Minnesota Timberwolves game. The incident, which occurred Saturday morning, prompted the NBA's decision to reschedule the match for Sunday. This marks the third such encounter with federal officers in Minnesota this month.

title: Investors‚Äô expectations from Union Budget 2026
content: The government should definitely make a uniform policy for accredited investors but with fewer norms. And before angel investors, the government should look at F&Os as they are even riskier and more speculative. Angel investing drives capital formation.

title: 'Simple guy, never got angry': College teacher stabbed to death on Mumbai local
content: In a shocking incident that unfolded on a packed local train at Malad station, Alok Singh, a 33-year-old junior college instructor known for his passion for math and statistics, was fatally stabbed after a disagreement over exiting the train. The assailant, as of now unidentified, launched the attack in full view of other passengers.

title: Supreme Court judge slams collegium for transfer on government nudge
content: Supreme Court Justice Ujjal Bhuyan voiced strong dissent over the collegium's decision to transfer Justice Atul Sreedharan, citing executive influence. He argued that such transfers, especially when prompted by the central government, compromise judicial independence and the integrity of the collegium system. Justice Bhuyan emphasized the judiciary's reliance on public faith.

title: Over 13,000 flights cancelled! US snow storm hits air travel, more disruptions expected
content: A massive winter storm has caused widespread flight cancellations across the United States, with over 13,000 flights grounded between Saturday and Monday. This disruption is among the most severe in years, impacting major hubs from Texas to New England. Airlines and airports implemented contingency measures and winter preparations to mitigate the extensive impact.

title: Ahmedabad flat horror: Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil‚Äôs nephew shoots wife
content: A shooting initially deemed accidental in Bodakdev has been reclassified as murder. Police now believe Yashrajsinh Gohil, nephew of Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil, intentionally shot his wife Rajeshwari before taking his own life. Forensic and ballistic evidence ruled out accidental discharge. The investigation revealed the fatal shot struck Rajeshwari at the base of her head.

title: Avalanche alert in Uttarakhand: Warning issued for high-altitude areas
content: Avalanche risks loom over the higher altitudes of Uttarakhand for the next 24 hours. Both locals and visitors are urged to steer clear of unnecessary journeys. There's a significant danger level 2 (Yellow) declared in various districts peaking over 2,800m, while Chamoli exceeds level 3 (Orange) above 3,000m.

title: Assam SIR: Opposition flags 'misuse' of Form-7; CM says notices sent only to ‚Äòmiyas‚Äô
content: Assam's electoral roll revision has sparked a political storm, with opposition parties accusing the government of misusing Form-7 to harass genuine voters, particularly targeting "miya" Muslims. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma defended the process, stating notices are aimed at alleged illegal immigrants to keep them under pressure, while the election department assures a legal process for all objections.

title: 'Blackmail cricket world': PCB chief Naqvi under fire over pullout remarks
content: Former India cricketer Atul Wassan slammed PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi‚Äôs remarks on possibly skipping the 2026 T20 World Cup, calling it ‚Äúfoolish bravado.‚Äù He said dragging politics into cricket hurts players, not administrators. Wassan felt Pakistan was backing Bangladesh for political mileage. His comments followed Naqvi‚Äôs criticism of the ICC after Bangladesh were replaced by Scotland for refusing to follow the tournament schedule.

title: Happy Republic Day 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to share
content: India celebrates its 76th Republic Day on January 26, 2026, commemorating the adoption of its Constitution. The grand parade on Kartavya Path will highlight military strength, cultural diversity, and technological advancements, with a special focus on the 150th anniversary of 'Vande Mataram'. Dignitaries from the European Council and Commission will attend as chief guests.

title: 'Bangladesh overplayed its hand': Former BCB secretary slams T20 World Cup pullout
content: Former Bangladesh Cricket Board official Suyed Ashraful Haque has slammed the nation's withdrawal from the T20 World Cup, deeming it an unnecessary and detrimental decision. He argued that linking participation to an IPL player's exclusion was misguided, as ICC events boast superior security. Haque warned this move jeopardizes Bangladesh cricket's progress, with Scotland now replacing them.

title: ‚ÄòDivine‚Äô dog had neuro trouble, rescued by vets
content: A Bijnor dog, celebrated by locals for its almost spiritual ritual of circling a Hanuman statue, has found refuge after intervention from animal rights activists. The dog's unusual behavior was traced back to a neurological condition caused by a tick-borne disease. Thankfully, Bhairav, the canine in question, has since received urgent veterinary care and is on a path to recovery.

title: Reggie Miller urges Stephen Curry to call Giannis as father time knocks
content: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Goa: Police debunk Russian man's claim of killing 19 women; 2 murders confirmed
content: A Russian national arrested for two murders in Goa claimed to have killed 19 women across India. Police investigations revealed most of these claims were unsubstantiated, with only two confirmed murders linked to the accused. Authorities are continuing to verify the remaining allegations.

title: Ailing wife in rickshaw van, 70-yr-old in Odisha cycles 600km to hospital & back
content: A 70-year-old man, Babu Lohar, pedalled his rickshaw van 300km to Cuttack with his ailing wife for medical treatment, refusing help. After two months, he is now making the arduous journey back home, showcasing immense devotion and highlighting the struggles of the poor in accessing healthcare and transport.

title: India votes against UN resolution censuring Iran
content: India voted against a UN Human Rights Council resolution condemning Iran's protest crackdown, extending a fact-finding mission. This move, aligning with China and Pakistan, signals India's commitment to non-interference and its strategic interests, particularly concerning the Chabahar port. Iran's envoy lauded India's 'principled and firm support' against what he termed an 'unjust' resolution.

title: US winter storm: Donald Trump approves emergency declarations across multiple states
content: President Trump approved emergency declarations for ten states facing severe winter storms, with federal agencies coordinating with state officials to ensure public safety.  The major storm brought heavy snow and dangerous ice across large parts of the country, impacting millions and causing widespread flight cancellations.

title: Who was Alex Pretti? 37-year-old identified as man shot dead by federal officers in Minneapolis
content: In a tragic turn of events, 37-year-old Alex Jeffrey Pretti, a US citizen, was shot dead by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis. Officials confirmed that during a large immigration enforcement operation, Pretti brandished a weapon and resisted arrest, prompting a Border Patrol agent to open fire in self-defense.

title: Silver lining: Woman lives 25 years with a donor heart
content: Preeti Unhale, 51, has become India's longest-living heart transplant survivor, marking 25 years with a donor heart on January 23, 2026.  Facing a critical condition in 2000, she underwent the life-saving procedure at AIIMS, demonstrating remarkable resilience and adherence to lifelong medical discipline.

title: Get rid of issues you faced in govt offices, PM Modi tells 61k recruits
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged over 61,000 newly-recruited personnel to recall their past difficulties with government offices and ensure citizens do not face similar issues. He emphasized their role in implementing reforms and upholding the motto 'Citizen is akin to God' to strengthen ease of living and doing business.

title: Donald Trump praises ‚Äòbrave‚Äô British soldiers; remarks follow row over Nato, Afghanistan
content: Donald Trump lauded British soldiers as "great and very brave warriors" in Afghanistan, a day after UK PM Keir Starmer condemned Trump's earlier remarks about NATO allies' frontline contributions as "insulting and appalling." Trump reiterated his skepticism about NATO's collective defense. Starmer paid tribute to the 457 British service personnel who died in Afghanistan, calling Trump's comments deeply hurtful.

title: Josh Allen's $8.5M mansion move amid injury fears, Steinfeld era
content: Josh Allen, the Buffalo Bills‚Äô star player, started the season with a lot of hopes, until it came crashing down as the Buffalo Bills lost brutally against the Denver Broncos in the divisional round. Though Josh Allen has a lot to look forward to this year as he and his wife, Hailee Steinfeld, are all set to become parents soon, he is also recovering from a brutal injury on his right foot. Amid all the mess, Josh Allen makes a shocking $8.5 million move which has raised eyebrows.

title: Bangladesh polls see 80 minority candidates; parties, independents in the fray
content: A significant 80 candidates from religious and ethnic minority groups are vying for seats in Bangladesh's upcoming national election, with 12 running independently.  While the ruling Awami League is absent, 22 parties, including BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami, have put forward 68 minority candidates.  Notably, Jamaat-e-Islami has nominated its first-ever minority candidate.

title: J&K: Jailed MP Engineer Rashid gets interim bail to attend budget session in custody
content: A Delhi court granted interim bail to J&K MP Sheikh Abdul Rashid, allowing him to attend Parliament's budget session under armed escort.  Rashid, jailed since 2019 on UAPA charges, recently defeated Omar Abdullah in the Lok Sabha polls.  This limited relief permits him to participate in parliamentary proceedings while remaining in custody, a move welcomed by his party.

title: ICC announces updated fixtures after Bangladesh exit from T20 World Cup
content: Scotland steps in for Bangladesh at the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, after Dhaka cited security concerns for playing in India. The ICC confirmed Scotland will join Group C, with all other match details remaining unchanged. Bangladesh's refusal to travel despite security assurances led to their removal.

title: When big-fat weddings become soft targets for gangs
content: Punjab's wedding venues are becoming scenes of violence, with recent shootings including an AAP sarpanch's murder in Amritsar and a deadly gang shootout in Ludhiana. These incidents highlight lax firearm ban enforcement, poor venue security, and the alarming normalization of guns at social gatherings, leaving communities fearful.

title: Palash Muchhal files defamation case against producer who alleged he cheated on Smriti Mandhana
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal has filed a ‚Çπ10 crore defamation case against Sangli-based producer Vidnyan Mane. Mane had accused Muchhal of duping him of ‚Çπ40 lakh in a film project and also alleged he cheated on cricketer Smriti Mandhana. Mane claimed Muchhal promised profits and a role in his film 'Nazaria', but the project was never completed.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Alexander-Arnold not told to leave Real Madrid
content: 'FC TV' crew react to real madrid's 6-1 win over Monaco . reports in Spain have said Trent Alexander-Arnold has been told by interim manager Alvaro Arbeloa to leave Real Madrid this summer . he is due to return soon and continue his career at the Bernab√©u .

title: Who should've made the top 10? What were the biggest surprises?
content: the college football top 100 player rank list from the 2025-26 season is here . the real question is, did our selection committee get it right? were there any players who should've made the list but didn't?

title: Why feds call former Olympic snowboarder a 'modern-day Pablo Escobar'
content: Ryan Wedding, 44, and his associates allegedly trafficked more than $1 billion in cocaine across the u.s. and Canada . prosecutors laid out how wedding allegedly orchestrated multiple killings, including the assassination of a key government witness . wedding was born into a snow sports family .

title: UFC 324 expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: a matchup between lightweight fan favorites will headline the first fight card since Dec. 13 . paddy Pimblett, ESPN's no. 7-ranked lightweight, is undefeated in the UFC . his last win was a third-round knockout of Michael Chandler .

title: NBA buzz: Live updates, trades and intel from around the league
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . will the Memphis Grizzlies move on from Ja Morant after they've started to entertain offers ? will there be a surprise deal (or two)?

title: Can Carlos Alcaraz finally win the Australian Open?
content: world no. 1 has never won the australian open, nor has he played in the final of the tournament . despite all of Alcaraz's accolades, the title remains a stark omission from his r√©sum√© . the ATP's youngest-ever world number one has amassed a staggering $50 million in prize money .

title: UFC 324: Live results, analysis for Gaethje vs. Pimblett

title: From 'I Love Drake Maye' to 'Bakemas': Inside the sudden cult celebrity of Drake and Ann Michael Maye

content: Police will obtain a DNA profile from the traces of semen detected in the forensic report, officials said

title: Being voter not just constitutional privilege, but important duty: PM Modi
content: National Voters' Day is celebrated annually in India on January 25 to mark the foundation day of the Election Commission of India

title: A.P. Discoms perform well in national power utility rankings

title: Key accused in serial ‚Äòprasadam‚Äô killing cases gets life imprisonment
content: Simhadri  killed 10 people by serving them prasadam laced with cyanide;  another accused gets 10-year rigorous imprisonment for supplying the poison

title: In Frames: From African shores to Gujarat‚Äôs Gir
content: The Siddi Badshah community, descended from Africans brought to Junagadh centuries ago, thrives in Jambur and Shirvan villages of the Gir region

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) approaches police over two ‚Äòmissing‚Äô corporators in Kalyan civic body
content: The possibility of pressure, fraud, kidnapping or other criminal nature behind this incident cannot be ruled out,‚Äù Shiv Sena (UBT) Kalyan district chief Sharad Shivraj Patil said

title: Ahead of key Delhi summit, EU leaders to begin India visit; to be chief guests at Republic Day function
content: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen kickstarted her four-day visit to India on Saturday (January 24, 2026)

title: Wake up from hibernation and activate SIR war rooms, Abhishek tells Trinamool MPs
content: The TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee said the work relating to SIR will have to be done by party workers during the day and in the evening, a film highlighting the achievements of Mamata Banerjee‚Äôs government will be screened

title: The hope for peace to prevail
content: Amid the recent violence in neighbouring Bangladesh, Indian families who had migrated to Bihar‚Äôs north-eastern district of Kishanganj in the 1960s, are concerned about family members who decided to stay back.¬†Amarnath Tewary¬†tells the¬†stories of the migrants, who speak about the struggles of displacement and loss, as they now navigate worry

title: Koraput district administrator in Odisha bans sale of non-vegetarian food on Republic Day
content: Prohibiting non-vegetarian food items on a national holiday is nothing but a directive influenced by ideology of Rastriya Swayamsevak Sangh, says Koraput Lok Sabha MP Saptagiri Sankar Ulaka

title: AIDWA photo exhibition showcases women‚Äôs struggles
content: AIDWA Treasurer S. Punyavathy and Sudha S. inaugurated Art Exhibition Hall AND the Armed Struggles Gallery.

title: Rajasthan focuses on higher mining revenue targets in financial year-end
content: Director of Mines Mahaveer Prasad Meena said a revenue collection of ‚Çπ7,451.63 crore had been reported till January 21, which had recorded an increase of ‚Çπ627 crore over the amount of ‚Çπ6,824.54 crore collected in the same period during the financial year 2024-25.

title: Election Commission uploads on website names of people on logical discrepancies list following Supreme Court order
content: District electoral officers will now download the list and display it at panchayat bhavans and block offices in West Bengal

title: Government will extend full support for development of AIIMS: Minister Satya Kumar Yadav
content: The Minister said that within a short period, AIIMS-Mangalagiri have gained the trust of patients and said that out of the total 26 AIIMS in the country, 19 were operational and the remaining were in various stages of construction

title: India bears special responsibility to preserve, share principles of compassion, non-violence: Rijiju
content: ‚ÄúUnder the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India has undertaken a ‚Äòproactive responsibility‚Äô in providing an international platform for Buddhist monks, gurus, scholars, and thinkers, reinforcing the nation‚Äôs enduring commitment to peace and harmony,‚Äù Mr. Rijiju said

title: Women employees entitled to maternity leave for third pregnancy too, reiterates Madras High Court
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and Shamim Ahmed direct Chief Secretary to circular their order to all HoDs so that they do not deny such benefit in future

title: Chief Minister Stalin opposes NEET for allied and health care courses
content: In a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he says the National Commission for Allied and Health Care Professions has made a ‚Äòhasty and ad hoc decision‚Äô with ‚Äòmultiple deleterious consequences‚Äô

title: Migrant worker from Beldanga ‚Äòdied by suicide‚Äô in Jharkhand, says West Bengal Police
content: Violence erupted at¬†Beldanga¬†in Murshidabad on January 16 over the death of 30-year-old migrant worker Alauddin Sheikh; a large number of people took to the streets by blocking railway tracks and national highway for several hours

title: Internet back in two Assam districts after violence-induced shutdown
content: The district authorities said life was slowly returning to normal in Kokrajhar, but security would continue to be high

title: Home Ministry to display tableau on three new criminal laws at Republic Day parade
content: It will showcase India‚Äôs transition to a modern, technology-driven, time-bound, and citizen-centric justice system, says the Ministry

title: Delhi court acquits Medha Patkar in defamation case filed by L-G V.K. Saxena
content: Court says neither the reporter who recorded the audio-video nor any person who had seen the accused making the impugned statements had been examined as a witness

title: Citing threat to public order, MHA orders blocking of Manipur killing video
content: Social media intermediaries such as YouTube, Meta, and Google have been directed to take down the viral video of the January 21 killing of a 29-year-old man in Manipur‚Äôs Churachandpur

title: India's youth must remain prepared to take on every challenge: Rajnath
content: The Defence Minister described NCC cadets as the nation‚Äôs second line of defence and urged them to contribute to Modi-led government‚Äôs vision of making India a developed nation by 2047, while addressing a gathering of cadets in Delhi Cantonment

title: Karnataka Ombudsman has heard 108 HIV Act complaints since July 2021
content: The complaints pertained to stigma, discrimination, and denial of services between July, 2021, and December, 2025

title: Forward Bloc urges govt. to avoid bringing back Netaji‚Äôs ashes
content: At gathering to mark Netaji‚Äôs 129th birth anniversary, G. Devarajan, General Secretary of the All India Forward Bloc, asks the government to formally accept the Mukherjee Commission Report, which concluded that Bose did not die in the alleged plane crash in Taiwan, on August 18, 1945

title: Five feared trapped as fire engulfs furniture store in Nampally; eyewitnesses recall horror
content: The building forms part of a tightly packed row of furniture showrooms and commercial establishments, a factor that, according to officials, contributed to the rapid spread of fire and smoke

title: SIR rollout in remaining States soon: CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: On the eve of the Election Commission's foundation day ‚Äî also celebrated as National Voters' Day ‚Äî Mr. Kumar said the revision exercise is presently being conducted "smoothly" in 12 States and Union territories

title: R-Day celebrations: 37 contingents to take part in the parade; traffic diversions announced
content: Citizens interested in attending the event can obtain passes through the Seva Sindhu website. Around 2,000 e-passes have been issued for the general public

title: Nipah scare: RT-PCR tests conducted on bats at Kolkata zoo
content: Samples have recently been collected from bat populations in Madhyamgram, Barasat and Basirhat in West Bengal; Alipore Zoo remains the only facility in Kolkata that houses a bat enclosure, prompting health authorities to include it in the surveillance drive

title: RJD MLA Bhai Virendra questions ticket distribution by party leadership

title: Akali Dal plans to start campaigns early for 2027 Punjab Assembly polls

title: CBSE makes appointment of socio-emotional, career counsellors mandatory in all affiliated schools
content: The proposed policy reform is aimed at strengthening students' mental health and providing them with career guidance

title: People might not have anticipated SIR to be more cumbersome than routine revisions: Kerala CEO

content: Kerala has topped the list for State-wise share of population aged above 60 for some years now. From 16.5% of its population aged above 60 in 2021, Kerala will have 18.7% in the category in 2026 and 22.8% by 2036
